questions.questionText: Arrange the following SSL/TLS protocol versions in chronological order from earliest to latest:

items.text: SSL 3.0 introduced to address security flaws
TLS 1.0 supersedes SSL as new standard
TLS 1.1 adds protection against cipher block chaining attacks
TLS 1.2 becomes widely adopted for modern security
TLS 1.3 streamlines handshake and removes obsolete features

questions.hint: Consider the evolution from SSL to TLS and how each version built upon the previous one's security improvements
questions.explanation: SSL/TLS protocols evolved chronologically: SSL 2.0 was the first widely used version (1995), followed by SSL 3.0 (1996). TLS succeeded SSL, starting with TLS 1.0 (1999), then TLS 1.1 (2006), TLS 1.2 (2008), and most recently TLS 1.3 (2018). Each version addressed security concerns from the previous one.

questions.questionText: Arrange the following steps of photosynthesis in the correct order:

items.text: Light energy is absorbed by chlorophyll
Water molecules are split into hydrogen and oxygen
ATP and NADPH are produced in the light reactions
Carbon dioxide is fixed in the Calvin cycle
Glucose is synthesized from carbon compounds

questions.hint: Think about what happens first in the light-dependent reactions and then moves to the Calvin cycle
questions.explanation: Photosynthesis occurs in two main stages: the light-dependent reactions (steps 1-3) where light energy is captured and used to produce ATP and NADPH, followed by the light-independent Calvin cycle (steps 4-5) where carbon dioxide is fixed and glucose is synthesized.

questions.questionText: Put the following events of the American Revolution in chronological order:

items.text: Boston Tea Party protest against British taxation
First Continental Congress convenes to coordinate colonial response
First military confrontations at Lexington and Concord

questions.hint: Think about the escalation from protest to political action to armed conflict to formal separation
questions.explanation: The sequence follows the escalation of tensions: the Boston Tea Party (1773) was a protest against British taxation, which led to the First Continental Congress (1774), then to armed conflict at Lexington and Concord (1775), and finally to the formal Declaration of Independence (1776). Dates are provided here for learning, but items don't include them to test understanding.
